title: 109_s3911
content: The Act is titled the "Wool Suit Fabric Labeling Fairness and International Standards Conforming Act." It focuses on labeling wool and cashmere products to ensure compliance and protect consumers. The Wool Products Labeling Act of 1939 is amended to include new paragraphs specifying the average diameter of wool fiber for products labeled as 'Super 80's', 'Super 90's', 'Super 100's', and 'Super 110's'. The Wool Products Labeling Act of 1939 now includes specifications for wool products labeled as 'Super 120's' to 'Super 160's', based on the average diameter of wool fiber. The Wool Products Labeling Act of 1939 specifies wool products labeled as 'Super 160's' to 'Super 200's' based on the average diameter of wool fiber. The Wool Products Labeling Act of 1939 categorizes wool products as 'Super 160's' to 'Super 250's' based on the average diameter of wool fiber, ranging from 13.75 microns to 11.25 microns or finer. The Wool Products Labeling Act of 1939 categorizes wool products based on fiber diameter, ranging from 13.75 microns to 11.25 microns or finer. Regulations by the Commission may apply to average fiber diameter standards for wool products labeled as cashmere. The amendments made by this section apply to wool products manufactured on or after January 1, 2007, with a coefficient of variation around the mean fiber diameter not exceeding 24 percent.
